paragraph.paragraph: The General property page in the Common Properties folder contains the following properties:

Assembly Name
The name of the output file that will hold the assembly manifest. Changing this property will also change the Output File property.

Default Namespace
The assembly's root namespace that all compiled types will be prefixed by.

Output Type
The type of application to build.
Console Application: Permits usage of the Microsoft Windows command-line interface.
Windows Application: An application that makes use of either the Windows GUI or .NET Windows Form GUI.
Class Library: A library of all classes contained within the project.
Precompiled Library: The same output as Class Library but includes additional compiler information that can be used by other EiffelEnvision projects through the precompiled.xmlprecompiled_libraryPrecompiled Library property.Note: Due to the complexities of resolving non-.NET specific language enhancements such as ../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/30_inheritance.xmlMultiple Inheritance and ../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/20_language/40_genericity.xmlGenerics, EiffelEnvision projects can only reference Precompiled Library projects through the precompiled.xmlprecompiled_libraryPrecompiled Library property.

Include All Classes
Indicates to the Eiffel for .NET compiler if all classes present in the project should be included in the compiled assembly. When No, only those classes reachable from the build.xmlroot_classRoot Class will be compiled into the project's assembly.

Target CLR Version
The specific version of the Common Language Runtime (CLR) the project should target. Only the versions of the CLR installed will be available in this option. Recommended: For maximum compatibility it is strongly recommended the Target CLR Version property remain set to Default. Although EiffelEnvision is able to resolve the correct versions of any referenced Microsoft .NET Framework assemblies it cannot resolve third party referenced assemblies. Warning: Changing this property *may* require a complete ../../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlbuilding_projectsRebuild and will be enforced when selecting to ../../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlbuilding_projectsBuild your project.
For more information on targeting alternative versions of the CLR, see multiple_clr_versions.xmlWorking with Multiple Versions of the .NET Framework.

Cluster Namespace Format
EiffelEnvision supports the generation of assembly type namespaces through its ../../../../../../technologies/dotnet/eiffel_dotnet_language/10_conventions/10_terminology.xmlclustercluster mechanism. There are three available options:
None: Will not generate any namespaces in the assembly.
Cluster Name: Generates namespace for defined project clusters only.
Full Cluster Name: Generates namespace for defined cluster and their subfolders.Warning: Changing this property requires a complete rebuild and will be enforced when selecting to ../../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlbuilding_projectsBuild your project.

.NET Naming Convention
Converts all Eiffel class names, feature names and namespaces into the .NET framework's defined naming conventions (Pascal-cased names). Warning: Changing this property requires a complete rebuild and will be enforced when selecting to ../../../compiling_projects/compiling_projects.xmlbuilding_projectsBuild your project.

Project Folder
The name of the project file for the current project. This is a read-only property while the project is open in Visual Studio.

Output File
The name of the project's primary output file (also known as the program image). The file that holds the assembly metadata must be the output file of this application. Therefore, Output File is a read-only property that can only be changed by changing the general.xmlassembly_nameAssembly Name property.

Key File Name
The key file to sign the project's primary output. To generate a new key use the Generate... option, to locate an existing key use Browse...

Wrapper Key File Name
The key file to sign COM components referenced by this project. COM components can be referenced via the Add Reference dialog box. To generate a new key use the Generate... option, to locate an existing key use Browse...
